ygData.msgSnippet: ============================================== Twinstar Synopsis: Twinstar, a kind hearted Dark Elf, has just learned that if she doesn t leave her
ygData.messageBody:
==============================================<br>Twinstar<br><br>Synopsis: Twinstar, a kind hearted Dark Elf, has just
learned that if she doesn't leave her home in Neriak
immediately and travel the world in search for answers to
questions she doesn't hasn't formed, she'll bring an end to
the Norrath forever. <br><br>Excerpt from Chapter 1:
The
Gypsy<br>-----------------------------------<br><br>Twinstar sat alone, aside from her loyal skeletal pet
standing guard, in the grass at the base of a dark and
dreary hill in an already dark and dreary forest. Her
eyes were filled with fear and confusion and she had a
headache from thinking too much. In her hands, she fumbled
slowly with a large precious stone, red in color.
Perhaps it was a ruby, but she wasn∩┐╜t sure; she was just
trying to distract herself from why she was really here.
<br><br>At a distance she could see the backside of an
ancient and long-since ruined temple, cursed to be
forever haunted by the undead. Such a temple, so close to
the entrance to her home city, proved convenient
training grounds for the warriors and mages of her people,
the Dark Elves of Norrath. On this side of the
temple, however, was nothing of any importance or
consequence, so Twinstar knew this was a place she could be
alone. And today she needed her privacy more than ever.
<br><br>"Do you think she was serious?" Came a familiar and
friendly voice. She glanced up at the source of the voice,
her pet. In her mind, she could see his lips moving
as the words had formed, but he had no lips. She
laughed a little at the thought, but her mood stifled it
quickly. He was merely a summoned pet, no different from
any other. Except that he could talk and he was a
fully sentient being, capable of making his own
decisions; not a mindless drone like every other pet
Twinstar had ever heard of. Why he was so different was
still a mystery to both of them. <br><br>After a few
moments, she returned her gaze returned to the stone in
her hands. "I... I don∩┐╜t know, Dolan," she responded
distantly. Her voice was weak and quiet, strained by the
weight on her shoulders. Her whole body felt the weight.
She sat there for several moments in silence before
she continued. "I wish I could just shrug this off--I
would have shrugged it off... but she knew about you.
How can I explain that away?∩┐╜ Dolan stood there in
silence, staring off into space as though he were the
witless pet he was supposed to be. He knew as well as she
did how important it was that they keep his
uniqueness a secret. Most Dark Elves were suspicious and
superstitious folk; if anyone found out, the consequences could
be disastrous. Twinstar had every right to be
concerned for that reason alone. If they couldn∩┐╜t explain
that, then everything else the Gypsy had told them
would hold an undeniable credibility and it was that
point that brought them here today. <br><br>"There has
to be plenty of reasonable explanations. Maybe she
just figured it out? We couldn∩┐╜t have expected to keep
this secret forever," he said finally. It was a weak
argument, he knew, but it was all he could offer.
<br><br>"But she said your name, Dolan, remember? Maybe she
figured it out, but then how could she have known your
name?" Twinstar was becoming more and more sure that
there was no way the Gypsy could have known that much.
They∩┐╜d spent the last few years guarding this secret
fiercely. She∩┐╜d told only one person and he∩┐╜d never betray
her, she was sure of it. There wasn∩┐╜t any way she
could explain this away. Her mood tipped even further
down, now. "I think we∩┐╜re in much deeper than either of
us realize."
<br>=============================================<br><br>To read more, please visit the Interactive Story at:
<a href=http://www.stories.com/main/interact.php?action=view&item_id=148315 target=new>http://www.stories.com/main/interact.php?action=view&item_id=148315</a><br><br>Please come by and visit! I would really appriciate the
input if nothing else.<br><br>Sincerely,<br>Darkmyst -
